page.title: 03TRADE -TAUNTON CATTLE MARKET
page.content: Taunton has the largest cattle market in the South West of England and is in the top ten cattle markets in Britain. Over 7000 head of stock is sold weekly and there is also a produce market and an open market. The market site covers 7 acres but is still not large enough and there are plans to extend it. Farmers bring stock in from a 50 mile radius and buyers come from as far afield as Scotland, Ireland and France. Animals are sent to most E.E.C. countries and many sheep are sent for slaughter to the Middle East. Apart from animals farmers bring in cream, chicken, eggs, cheese and vegetables for sale in the Produce Hall. Outside there are 60 stalls selling a variety of goods from fresh fish to clothing.
